content:
• Wednesday, December 26, 2012
  • MACK

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:30 p.m.: MACK +5%. CLDX +4%. FOLD +4%. IDIX +3%. NBIX...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:30 p.m.: MACK +5%. CLDX +4%. FOLD +4%. IDIX +3%. NBIX +2%.
    After-hours top losers: AMBA -2%. DGAZ -2%. MRVL -2%. DNDN -2%. PRSS -1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • DIOD

    Diodes (NASDAQ:DIOD) is buying BCD Semiconductor (NASDAQ:BCDS), a Chinese analog chipmaker...

    Diodes (NASDAQ:DIOD) is buying BCD Semiconductor (NASDAQ:BCDS), a Chinese analog chipmaker incorporated in the Cayman Islands, for $151M in cash, or $8/share. The price represents a 101% premium to BCD's close. BCD, which has $39M in cash/equivalents and has posted $112M in revenue over the last 12 months, expands Diodes' analog product line and gives it a chance to cross-sell to the major Chinese OEMs that rely on BCD. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • RAD

    Rite Aid (RAD +8.4%) posts a solid gain today on the back of a Seeking Alpha article which...

    Rite Aid (RAD +8.4%) posts a solid gain today on the back of a Seeking Alpha article which speculates that the company may be in the midst of a turnaround after posting a surprise profit last quarter. The story notes that stronger generic drug offerings - which traditionally have higher margins - was one of the biggest reasons for the increase in gross profit.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • GRPN

    'Tis the season for covering profitable tech shorts. A slew of beaten-down tech names, many of...

    'Tis the season for covering profitable tech shorts. A slew of beaten-down tech names, many of them with giant short interests, are joining RIM and Chinese solar stocks in closing higher today, even as the NASDAQ finishes lower. GRPN +3.7% RENN +3.6%. SPWR +6.8%. ZNGA +3%. JIVE +2.5%. BIDU +5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • CEI

    Lucas Energy (LEI +19%) soars after saying it recently completed the sale of it Baker Deforest...

    Lucas Energy (LEI +19%) soars after saying it recently completed the sale of it Baker Deforest Unit, located in Gonzales and Dewitt Counties, Texas, for $4M. The company on Friday also announced the appointment of Ryan J. Morris as its chairman of the board of directors and amended and restated its bylaws, including the reduction of the required ownership percentage of stockholders required to call a special meeting to at least 10% of all shares entitled to vote, which is down from 30%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • MRVL

    Marvell (MRVL -6.6%) dives after being ordered by a jury to pay $1.17B in damages in a patent...

    Marvell (MRVL -6.6%) dives after being ordered by a jury to pay $1.17B in damages in a patent suit, the WSJ reports. The chipmaker has been sued by Carnegie Mellon over a patent allegedly infringed by its hard drive controllers. Marvell (current market cap of $4.15B), which has been claiming prior art, will undoubtedly appeal, and probably see that damages figure reduced by a judge.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 3 Comments
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (JCP +4.1%) is continuing its December rally on a day when many other retailers are...

    J.C. Penney (JCP +4.1%) is continuing its December rally on a day when many other retailers are slumping thanks to negative sales data. With 42.6% of the float shorted as of Nov. 30, there's a good chance some shorts are opting to take profits before year's end. Oppenheimer issued bullish comments on JCP on Monday.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 6 Comments
  • MCK

    McKesson (MCK -1.2%) says it's received notification of early termination of the waiting period...

    McKesson (MCK -1.2%) says it's received notification of early termination of the waiting period under the Hart-Scott-Rodino Antitrust Improvements Act in connection with its proposed acquisition of PSS World Medical (PSSI +1.3%). The termination of the waiting period is just one of the obstacles it needs to hurdle in it's proposed acquisition of PSS World Medical.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • MTG

    Today's Case-Shiller figures are providing a lift to mortgage insurers MGIC (MTG +7.5%) and...

    Today's Case-Shiller figures are providing a lift to mortgage insurers MGIC (MTG +7.5%) and Radian (RDN +3.8%). "Higher values of homes improve the ratio of borrowers that go into default because there’s less people with negative equity," observes analyst Jason Stewart. Radian rallied on Monday after Freddie Mac extended a coverage writing deal for a Radian subsidiary through the end of 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • IPAR

    Inter Parfums (IPAR +4.5%) trades up after inking an exclusive, worldwide 10-year license deal...

    Inter Parfums (IPAR +4.5%) trades up after inking an exclusive, worldwide 10-year license deal to create and distribute perfumes and related products under the Alfred Dunhill brand, which focuses on luxury goods for men. The agreement, which starts on April 3, replaces a previous license deal Alfred Dunhill held with Procter & Gamble (PG -0.9%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • DMDA

    SuperMedia (SPMD +12.7%) and Dex One (DEXO +8.2%) rally after SA's Gleb Bradford offers a...

    SuperMedia (SPMD +12.7%) and Dex One (DEXO +8.2%) rally after SA's Gleb Bradford offers a bullish take on the companies' planned merger and Chapter 11 restructuring. Bradford notes SuperMedia and Dex's lenders are on board; that hedge fund manager Kyle Bass has bought 10% stakes in both companies, and that the companies forecast EBITDA of $719M in 2016. He also points out SuperMedia is trading at a discount to Dex One, based on the merger ratio.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • HLF

    Herbalife (HLF +8.5%) says it's hired a strategic adviser and will hold an analyst and investor...

    Herbalife (HLF +8.5%) says it's hired a strategic adviser and will hold an analyst and investor meeting next month in an effort to counter criticism by Pershing Square's Bill Ackman. The company also is considering legal action, though it wasn't immediately clear what direction that might take. Last week, Ackman disclosed he has been betting against HLF for months and built up a massive short position, which in turn appears to have turned the Street against the nutritional supplement marketer.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM | 7 Comments
  • CALL

    magicJack VocalTec (CALL +4.7%) rallies after CEO Dan Borislow tells Bloomberg his company...

    magicJack VocalTec (CALL +4.7%) rallies after CEO Dan Borislow tells Bloomberg his company should beat Q4 estimates, and is "stumped" by the recent drop in its shares. Also: magicJack disclosed today it has settled a payment dispute with Verizon, and announced it has developed a VoIP box that can more easily work with Wi-Fi and 4G connections thanks to its inclusion of additional ports.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM | 2 Comments
  • PRGNF

    Paragon Shipping (PRGN -2.2%) slips after selling over 4.9M newly-issued shares to an entity...

    Paragon Shipping (PRGN -2.2%) slips after selling over 4.9M newly-issued shares to an entity affiliated with Michael Bodouroglou, its Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, for $10M. The transaction closed on December 24. PRGN will have the right to repurchase these newly-issued shares at the same price per share at which they were sold in the placement, on successful amendment by PRGN of its outstanding loan agreements or March 29, whichever comes earliest.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • VIAV

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU +1.4%) and Finisar (FNSR +1.5%) tick higher after Piper's Troy Jensen...

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU +1.4%) and Finisar (FNSR +1.5%) tick higher after Piper's Troy Jensen forecasts optical component makers will post better-than-expected 2H13 sales thanks to rising carrier capex. Jensen also predicts JDS will see market share gains. Oclaro (OCLR -2.3%) isn't joining in on the fun.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • MNKD

    Shares of MannKind (MNKD +5.7%) get a boost on a big vote of confidence from its Chairman and...

    Shares of MannKind (MNKD +5.7%) get a boost on a big vote of confidence from its Chairman and CEO Alfred Mann today, after the company revealed in a filing that he had recently purchased 40M shares at an average price of $2.59. The total price tag on the purchase: $103M. That brings Mann's total ownership in the company up to just under 75M shares. (SEC Form 4 Filing)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 2 Comments
  • STP

    Chinese solar stocks are up strongly. Shorts may be booking some of the big profits they earned...

    Chinese solar stocks are up strongly. Shorts may be booking some of the big profits they earned this year. STP +6.4%. YGE +6.7%. TSL +8%. CSIQ +5.8%. LDK +6%. JASO +6%. Shares took off last week after the Chinese government announced it wants to see industry consolidation.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • SGOC

    Midday top 10 gainers: SGOC +78%. DQ +32%. LEI +17%. CT +13%. SPMD +13%. GOL +11%. CSUN +11%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: SGOC +78%. DQ +32%. LEI +17%. CT +13%. SPMD +13%. GOL +11%. CSUN +11%. SOL +10%. ALIM +10%. SPWR +10%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: MED -13%. AERL -8%. AMPL -10%. BNSO -10%. BOSC -8%. MOC -8%. KORS -7%. RWC -7%. PSMI -6%. OTC:SDIX -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • ITMN

    Three members of an independent FDA advisory panel say they received advanced information ahead...

    Three members of an independent FDA advisory panel say they received advanced information ahead of U.S. regulators in May 2010 regarding the rejection of a drug from InterMune (ITMN -2.5%), which is now at the heart of a trading investigation of SAC Capital. ITMN’s shares fell 5.4% the day before the company announced the rejection. However, others at the FDA were also aware of the rejection too, and there’s no evidence the 11 panelists did anything wrong.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • SHLDQ

    Many retail stocks are diving after MasterCard and ShopperTrak release data indicating holiday...

    Many retail stocks are diving after MasterCard and ShopperTrak release data indicating holiday season sales were light. SHLD -3.6%. GPS -3%. NKE -2.9%. M -2.6%. GME -3.2%. AEO -3.6%. LTD -2.7%. ARO -3.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • DQ

    Shares of Daqo New Energy (DQ +35%) pop today after saying it's appointed Arthur Wong as an...

    Shares of Daqo New Energy (DQ +35%) pop today after saying it's appointed Arthur Wong as an independent director of the company, effective immediately. Mr. Wong, who currently serves as an independent director for VisionChina Media and China Automotive Systems, will also serve as the chair for DQ's Audit Committee, a member of the Compensation Committee and a member of the Corporate Governance and Nominating Committee.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • ANRZQ

    Some coal stocks are having a good day.  ANR +5.2%. ACI +2.7%. WLT +2.6%. Peabody (BTU...

    Some coal stocks are having a good day.  ANR +5.2%. ACI +2.7%. WLT +2.6%. Peabody (BTU +1.5%) disclosed a management shakeup for its American and Australian units this morning.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • LULU

    Lululemon (LULU -3.1%) is selling off. Notable Calls attributes the move to major discounts that...

    Lululemon (LULU -3.1%) is selling off. Notable Calls attributes the move to major discounts that have appeared on the yoga retailer's site, something that could be stoking fears of soft January quarter demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM | 3 Comments
  • NOW

    ServiceNow (NOW -6.4%) slumps following the end of an IPO lockup expiration. 5M shares have...

    ServiceNow (NOW -6.4%) slumps following the end of an IPO lockup expiration. 5M shares have become eligible for sale today, boosting the size of the IT service desk software firm's float by 15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • BB

    Is it mere short-covering or something more? RIM (RIMM +7.7%) is rallying strongly on a quiet...

    Is it mere short-covering or something more? RIM (RIMM +7.7%) is rallying strongly on a quiet day after getting crushed in the wake of its FQ3 report. 113.7M shares were shorted as of Nov. 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM | 17 Comments
  • YGE

    Yingli Green Energy (YGE +6.4%) moves higher this morning after reporting it's PANDA module has...

    Yingli Green Energy (YGE +6.4%) moves higher this morning after reporting it's PANDA module has achieved "great performance" in the TUV Rheinland 2011 Energy Yield Test. All modules were tested under high temperature and low irradiation from September, 2011 to August, 2012, and results showed the electricity output of YGE's module ranked number two, just 0.6% below the top performer and 5% higher than the lowest ranking module.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • MED

    Medifast (MED -15.2%) tumbles after disclosing interim CFO Edward Power will resign by Jan. 4 to...

    Medifast (MED -15.2%) tumbles after disclosing interim CFO Edward Power will resign by Jan. 4 to "pursue other interests." Powers took over just last month, following the resignation of former CFO Brendan Connors. Director of Finance Joseph Kelleman will be the new interim CFO.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • GOL

    Brazilian airline Gol Linhas (NYSE:GOL) gains 8.6% as it reiterates plans to maybe IPO its...

    Brazilian airline Gol Linhas (NYSE:GOL) gains 8.6% as it reiterates plans to maybe IPO its Smiles frequent-flyer program. The timing remains uncertain.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM
  • GOL

    Premarket gainers: GOL +8%. 

    Premarket gainers: GOL +8%.Â 
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • SINA

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) -3.5% after the company shoots down a rumor (originally surfaced in November)...

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) -3.5% after the company shoots down a rumor (originally surfaced in November) that Alibaba is planning to buy a 15%-20% stake in its Weibo microblogging platform at a hefty valuation. Shares fell on Monday, along with those of other Chinese Internet stocks, on news the government is weighing a law that would require all Internet users to register their real names.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • HLF

    The stars align for a nice bounce in Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) as at least one satiated fund manager...

    The stars align for a nice bounce in Herbalife (NYSE:HLF) as at least one satiated fund manager covers his short and Whitney Tilson - announcing his own short in the company - proclaims Bill Ackman's 342 page treatise on Herbalife "the most remarkable piece of investment analysis I have ever seen." Shares +2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM | 8 Comments
  • HLF

    A bear fund manager covers his big short in Herbalife. Too far too fast, says Ranger Equity Bear...

    A bear fund manager covers his big short in Herbalife. Too far too fast, says Ranger Equity Bear ETFÂ (NYSEARCA:HDGE) portfolio manager Brad Lamensdorf, who notes the issues raised by Bill Ackman are nothing new. Lamensdorf returns his focus to what he calls a "target rich" short environment. HLF -0.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM | 2 Comments
